<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Instruction::dropUnknownNonDebugMetadata (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; KnownIDs=&#123;&#125;)</>}>
Drop all unknown metadata except for debug locations.

Passes are required to drop metadata they don&#39;t understand. This is a convenience method for passes to do so. dropUBImplyingAttrsAndUnknownMetadata should be used instead of this API if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> being modified is a call.

### applyMergedLocation() {#ae88ca601f663c55cafa95cf742076aad}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Instruction::applyMergedLocation (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a> &#42; LocA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a> &#42; LocB)</>}>
Merge 2 debug locations and apply it to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>.

If the instruction is a CallIns, we need to traverse the inline chain to find the common scope. This is not efficient for N-way merging as each time you merge 2 iterations, you need to rebuild the hashmap to find the common scope. However, we still choose this API because: 1) Simplicity: it takes 2 locations instead of a list of locations. 2) In worst case, it increases the complexity from O(N&#42;I) to O(2&#42;N&#42;I), where N is # of Instructions to merge, and I is the maximum level of inline stack. So it is still linear. 3) Merging of call instructions should be extremely rare in real applications, thus the N-way merging should be in code path. The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a> attached to this instruction will be overwritten by the merged <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/debugloc">DebugLoc</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h/#l00694">694</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfo-cpp/#l00949">949</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfo-cpp">DebugInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Used to copy debugging information from one block to another, when copying entire blocks.

### comesBefore() {#a784097fca76abad9e815cf1692de79c4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Instruction::comesBefore (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; Other) const</>}>
Given an instruction Other in the same basic block as this instruction, return true if this instruction comes before Other.

In this worst case, this takes linear time in the number of instructions in the block. The results are cached, so in common cases when the block remains unmodified, it takes constant time.

### getFunction() {#a6a66ebb3aa12757479a3c88de77d78f8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const Function &#42; Instruction::getFunction () const</>}>
Return the function this instruction belongs to.

Note: it is undefined behavior to call this on an instruction not currently inserted into a function.

### hasSameSpecialState() {#a566048bdbd8bade381b6a52ed0244621}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Instruction::hasSameSpecialState (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I2, bool IgnoreAlignment=false, bool IntersectAttrs=false) const</>}>
This function determines if the speficied instruction has the same &quot;special&quot; characteristics as the current one.

This must be kept in sync with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functioncomparator/#aa359aa2850f74fbc9dbdb4650c13f4cf">FunctionComparator::cmpOperations</a> in <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/mergefunctions-cpp">lib/Transforms/IPO/MergeFunctions.cpp</a>.

This means that opcode specific details are the same. As a common example, if we are comparing loads, then hasSameSpecialState would compare the alignments (among other things). 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if the specific instruction has the same opcde specific characteristics as the current one. Determine if one instruction has the same state as another.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h/#l00963">963</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/instruction-cpp/#l00836">836</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/instruction-cpp">Instruction.cpp</a>.

### isNilpotent() {#a902c3b08cb9808fddc542ff284c28edb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::Instruction::isNilpotent () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if the instruction is nilpotent:

Nilpotent operators satisfy: x op x === Id,

where Id is the identity for the operator, i.e. a constant such that x op Id === x and Id op x === x for all x.

In LLVM, the Xor operator is nilpotent.

### mayHaveSideEffects() {#a6ea260be710ac7b61309534308da3147}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool Instruction::mayHaveSideEffects () const">
Return true if the instruction may have side effects.

Side effects are:
<ul>
<li>Writing to memory.</li>
<li>Unwinding.</li>
<li>Not returning (e.g. an infinite loop).</li>
</ul>


Note that this does not consider malloc and alloca to have side effects because the newly allocated memory is completely invisible to instructions which don&#39;t use the returned value. For cases where this matters, isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute may be more appropriate.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h/#l00854">854</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/instruction-cpp/#l01185">1185</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/instruction-cpp">Instruction.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### mergeDIAssignID() {#a2711d3bc7c6c769a8f34c7fc3937169d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Instruction::mergeDIAssignID (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; &gt; SourceInstructions)</>}>
Merge the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diassignid">DIAssignID</a> metadata from this instruction and those attached to instructions in <code>SourceInstructions</code>.

This process performs a RAUW on the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/metadataasvalue">MetadataAsValue</a> uses of the merged <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diassignid">DIAssignID</a> nodes. Not every instruction in <code>SourceInstructions</code> needs to have <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diassignid">DIAssignID</a> metadata. If none of them do then nothing happens. If this instruction does not have a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/diassignid">DIAssignID</a> attachment but at least one in <code>SourceInstructions</code> does then the merged one will be attached to it. However, instructions without attachments in <code>SourceInstructions</code> are not modified.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h/#l00719">719</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instruction-h">Instruction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfo-cpp/#l00953">953</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/debuginfo-cpp">DebugInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
